intro: Hieracium carolinianum subsp. rugelii, commonly known as the Carolina hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, elongated achenes as fruits. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
